meanings.definition: A warning or indication of a future event.
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds were a forewarning of the coming storm.
meanings.sent2: The loud thunder was a forewarning of the approaching rain.
meanings.sent3: The chirping birds served as a forewarning of the sunrise.
meanings.sent4: The sudden drop in temperature was a forewarning of the winter ahead.
meanings.sent5: The distant sound of sirens acted as a forewarning of danger.

meanings.definition: To warn or inform in advance.
meanings.sent1: She tried to forewarning her friends about the traffic jam.
meanings.sent2: The weather forecast forewarned us of the heavy snowfall.
meanings.sent3: He forewarned his brother about the surprise party to avoid spoiling it.
meanings.sent4: The teacher forewarned the students about the upcoming pop quiz.
meanings.sent5: The wise old man forewarned the villagers of the approaching drought.
